Articles.Content: Not really a support request, just a heads-up on a bug, though I don't have proper reproduction, so I don't know how helpful it is. The "ejected from pod on EVA" bug is still around, apparently. It's *mostly* fixed, but I have had Valentina launched spinning at high velocity away from a basic Mk1 pod with a small parachute on top. It only happened the once. The camera spun around a fair bit on exiting to EVA, too, and it took a good 30-40 seconds before she stopped ragdolling through the void. I suspect it has something to do with the angle of the hatch vs what the game considered "up/down" (i.e. the orientation that an EVAd kerbal locks to in free-flight). Possibly also affected by the interstage faring on the heatshield below the pod, since the new part sticks out a bit.
